Description: Complete tunic in undyed linen, plain weave; height 1024cm, width with sleeves open c.180cm, base of tunic c.96cm; decoration of two clavi (front and back of tunic) and on each end of the sleeves, two parallel bands of tapestry; the decoration is in purple on a beige background and shows standing human figures depicted in a square panel and dseparated by small medallions with rabbits inside; the figures are naked, both male and female, and surrounded by vegetal motifs (maybe menids and satyrs?); the two selvedges are preserved indicating we have the full height of the tunic; the ends of the sleeves are also preserved and are finished with small knots; the sides of the tunic have been sewn with a run-and-fell seam; slit tapestry neck opening; there are several holes and traces of darning at the knee in linen thread; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/24), weft-undyed linen (S/12); tapestry on grouped threads (alternatively 3 and 2): warp-undyed linen (S/7), weft-undyed linen (S/60), purple wool (S/60); flying threads in undyed linen/S; oversewing threads in undyed linen (S/paired)
Dimensions: Height: 1024 centimetres (CHECK DIMENSIONS, assume this is 124cm rather than 1024cm)
Curator's comments: traces of blue paint on one side; similar to 18201 and 18202
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
